author: Staff Reporter
text:
Service lanes of NH 48 near Sathuvachari being widened to enable traffic diversion

Highways officials said preliminary works for constructing the subway have begun, starting with removal of encroachments near RTO Road at Sathuvachari in Vellore.— Photo: C. Venkatachalapathy

Preliminary works for constructing a subway across the National Highway 48 at Sathuvachari have commenced.

Encroachments along the service lanes on either side of the NH are being removed to enable widening of the stretches.

The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) had given its nod to construct a subway across the six-lane Chennai Bengaluru NH 48 at Sathuvachari (RTO Road point) following demands from residents for more than six years. Pedestrians have been facing difficulty in crossing the NH in the absence of such a facility.

Now, officials said preliminary works for constructing the subway have begun, starting with removal of encroachments.

The work began nearly three to four days ago.

“We are removing encroachments as per the land acquisition carried out by NHAI in 2001. Some of the shops have encroached upon the land acquired by NHAI. The drive will go on for a week,” an official said.

Once the encroachments are removed, officials will shift certain utilities such as major Ponnai water pipelines and electricity lines.

“The service lanes will be widened after the utilities are shifted. The service lanes will be widened from the existing six metres to eight metres,” he added.

Only after the service lanes are widened will officials be able to allow local traffic to flow, and also divert the main traffic from the NH into the service lanes to commence the subway construction work, he added.
title: Encroachments cleared for subway work
